TopicTitle: Scenarios: What do to in "Station One"

Articles.Content:
(Version 0.21.1)

Hi

What is the mission in scenario STATION ONE.

The text says: "Space Station 1 is a small refueling outpost at low Kerbin orbit, where ships can stop to fill up before leaving on interplanetary missions."

Do I have to take the plane which is docked or do I have to transfer the station to another planet? Do I have to refuel? Everything I see seems to be full of fuel already.

So, what should I do?

And when do I know the mission is completet?

Greetings

Kryloglyt

I think Station One is a sandbox scenario in a sandbox game; you can do pretty much as you wish with it. It's a good practice scenario for figuring out how to work with spaceplanes and how to pull EVAs if nothing else.

That's why it's called Scenario and not Mission.

You're given a space station. Crash into it, re-arrange it, use Whack A Kerbal to break it in half... Do whatever you want with it.

Oh, I see. It is *only* a scenario and has nothing to do with a mission.

It is up to my fantasy!

Thanks for your answers.

K.

(Where can I switch this thread to "answered"?)
There's a secret lander orbiting Duna in that scenario. Just so you know.

There's a secret lander orbiting Duna in that scenario. Just so you know.

I discoverd that a week ago.

ITS DARVIN THE DUNIAN!!!!
